net.sf.mmm.util.reflect.api

Interface PojoUtilLimited


  • public interface PojoUtilLimited
    This is a simple abstraction of reflective introspection solutions such as PojoPropertyAccessorBuilder or even PojoPathNavigator. However, within some limitations (a particular base-class or marker interface is required) this is GWT compatible and therefore abstracts intorspection to a minimum. Please note that there is no reflection available in GWT context and therefore you will have limitations. If your custom needs differ from what is offered out of the box, this is the place where to hook into.
    Since:
    3.1.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        <V> V copy(V value)
        This method creates a copy (e.g. via copy-constructor or clone) of the given value. If the given value is immutable (like String, Long, etc.) it is legal to return the same given instance.
        Type Parameters:
        V - is the generic type of the value to copy. Typically a TransferObject or a Datatype.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to copy.
        Returns:
        the copy of the value.

      • isDatatype

        boolean isDatatype(Object value)
        This method determines if the given object is a (immutable) Datatype. It will return true if the given value is a String, Boolean, Character, anything derived from Number, an Enum, an instance of Datatype, a Date (even though not immutable) or anything similar should be considered as datatype due to a custom extension.
        Parameters:
        value - is the object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is a (immutable) Datatype, false otherwise.

      • getProperties

        List<TypedProperty<?>> getProperties(Class<?> pojoType)
        This method gets an unmodifiable List with the properties of the given Pojo type.
        Parameters:
        pojoType - is the class reflecting the Pojo.
        Returns:
        a List with the properties of the given pojoType.
        See Also:
        PojoDescriptor.getPropertyDescriptors(), PojoDescriptorBuilderFactory

      • getPropertyValidator

        ValueValidator<?> getPropertyValidator(Class<?> pojoType,
                                       String propertyName)
        This method gets or creates the ValueValidator for the specified property derived from annotations (e.g. JSR 303 or JSR 308).
        ATTENTION:
        This is NOT an implementation of JSR 303 (javax.validation) nor is it strictly compatible to it. Instead this is an abstraction that may be implemented using JSR 303 or maybe not. However, we want to be GWT compatible and we want to directly bind the validation to the UI widgets (see UiWidgetWithValue#addValidator(ValueValidator)). The API of JSR 303 is unfortunately biased. A simple bridge to JSR 303 can be achieved via javax.validation.Validator.validateProperty(Object, String, Class).
        Parameters:
        pojoType - is the class reflecting the Pojo owning the property.
        propertyName - is the name of the property.
        Returns:
        the ValueValidator for the given property.

      • getPropertyValue

        Object getPropertyValue(Object pojo,
                        String propertyName)
        This method gets the value of the specified property.
        E.g. getPropertyValue(pojo, "foo") should return pojo.getFoo().
        Parameters:
        pojo - is the Pojo owning the property.
        propertyName - is the name of the property.
        Returns:
        the value of the specified property.

      • getPropertyValue

        <V> V getPropertyValue(Object pojo,
                       TypedProperty<V> property)
        This method gets the value of the specified property.
        Type Parameters:
        V - is the generic type of the requested property value.
        Parameters:
        pojo - is the Pojo owning the property.
        property - is the TypedProperty identifying the property to get.
        Returns:
        the value of the specified property.
        See Also:
        getPropertyValue(Object, String)

      • setPropertyValue

        void setPropertyValue(Object pojo,
                      String propertyName,
                      Object value)
        This method sets the value of the specified property.
        E.g. setPropertyValue(pojo, "foo", value) should have the same effect as pojo.setFoo(value).
        Parameters:
        pojo - is the Pojo owning the property.
        propertyName - is the name of the property.
        value - is the new property value to set.

      • setPropertyValue

        <V> void setPropertyValue(Object pojo,
                          TypedProperty<V> property,
                          V value)
        This method sets the value of the specified property.
        Type Parameters:
        V - is the generic type of the property value to set.
        Parameters:
        pojo - is the Pojo owning the property.
        property - is the TypedProperty identifying the property to set.
        value - is the new property value to set.
        See Also:
        setPropertyValue(Object, String, Object)
